title: smsm777
author: smsm777
content: Curve.com allows users to add multiple cards and select the currency the card is in. When you make a purchase, Curve then uses the interbank rates to settle the FX rate. So for example if you have a card in USD, you load it with USDT and use it in UK then your card company will add a markup which is normally around 2.5-3% on the FX rate. By using Curve this goes down to 0%. Therefor we can find cards with lowest funding fees and the FX rate does not matter really as Curve will provide real interbank rates here.I tried to add advcash virtual card but Curve declined it saying they do not accept Prepaid cards. I tried another card also but Curve gave same error. Does anyone know which crypto cards are supported by Curve? Anyone using this setup successful? Was thinking cards like:Nuri, wirex, plutus, CDC, Trastra, Monolith, ? Are any of these supported or does Curve not work with them?How can we found out before signing up for any card if its supported or not?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: smsm777 on June 25, 2022, 09:57:06 AMHow can we found out before signing up for any card if its supported or not? Have you contacted curve support? Fyi, they have basic requirements:Quote from: https://curve.kustomer.help/en_us/adding-cards-to-my-curve-wallet-S1_yBOhL_Your first card must be the UK or European Economic Area (EEA) issued debit or credit card. You’re welcome to add non-EEA cards once you receive and activate your Curve card.By the way they say they don't support most prepaid cards, but they don't mention any cards specifically. Based on the instructions, they are likely to add certain prepaid cards according to the user's request. You can try applying for your card by writing a form first.
